result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $6,986.95 payable to Progressive Insurance; and $3,783.00 payable to Steven K.  Joint and several to Charles Moore, Daetrell Watson and Tyrell Tolbert.

Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  restitution, all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including  DNA, Court waived nonmandatory costs.  All applicable fees of supervision.
All mandatory court costs, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

No alcohol or drugs.
No contact with coactor Tyrell Tolbert, Steven K., Dominique T., Leslie M. and  Anton W.
Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
No firearms or dangerous weapons, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised  he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 12/08/2016 received and filed. (29 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Public Defender Appointment, District Attorney, and Institution.

Defendant Travis L Smith in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Travis L Smith in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Melissa C. and Tynisha D.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 192 MONTHS with 660 (six hundred-sixty) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 96 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 96 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms or dangerous weapons, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with co-actor Tyrell Tolbert, Steven K., Dominique T., Leslie M., and Anton W.:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
 Restitution in the amount of $6,986.95 payable to Progressive Insurance and $3,783 payable to Steven K. (joint and several to Charles Moore, Daetrell Watson and Tyrell Tolbert).  
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travis L Smith in court with Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Travis L Smith in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts 2, 3 and 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2, 3 and 4   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.
